meanings.definition: To publicly recommend or support (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The teacher preconized the new student for their hard work in class.
meanings.sent2: The committee preconized the use of eco-friendly practices in the school.
meanings.sent3: The mayor preconized a talking parrot as the town's official mascot.
meanings.sent4: Her actions preconized a wave of kindness throughout the community.
meanings.sent5: The coach preconized the star player as the team's future leader.

meanings.sent1: The principal preconized the upcoming school event during the morning announcements.
meanings.sent2: The government preconized the new law to be implemented starting next month.
meanings.sent3: The cat preconized its territory by leaving paw prints all over the garden.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm preconized the arrival of a new season.
meanings.sent5: The alarm preconized the start of the important meeting.
